**Date:** Thursday April 10th, 2025 <br>
**Location:** Online <br>
**Time:** 12 pm - 2:30 pm GMT <br>
**Theme of the event:** Statistical Ecology <br>

The **Young Statisticians' Section of the <a href="https://istat.ie/" target="_blank">Irish Statistical Association**</a> (Young-ISA) was formed in 2019 to create and cultivate a network of career-young statisticians across Ireland, supporting their professional development and providing a link to the Irish Statistical Association.</p>

We are thrilled to announce our joint webinar with the British and Irish Region (BIR). The **Young-ISA webinar joint with the BIR Committee on Statistical Ecology** aims to bring together many career-young statisticians in Ireland to focus on the **application and theoretical development of statistical ecology**.


### Invited Speakers

[Prof Caroline Brophy](https://www.scss.tcd.ie/caroline.brophy/), Professor in Statistics, Trinity College Dublin, Ireland.

[Dr Virginia Morera-Pujol ](https://sites.google.com/view/virginiamorera-pujol/home?authuser=0), Postdoctoral Research Fellow, University College Dublin, Ireland.  

[Dr Rafael de Andrade Moral](https://rafamoral.github.io), Associate Professor in Statistics, Maynooth University, Ireland.

[Rebecca Akeresola](https://www.bioss.ac.uk/people/rakeresola), PhD Student in Statistics, University of Edinburgh, UK.  

<br>
